cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 510 miles SSE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest to north-northwest toward the central Texas Gulf Coast, then forecast to meander near or just inland and possibly drift just offshore of the upper Texas coast later this weekend

weather_observation.under_watch: Tropical Storm Watch and Storm Surge Watch
weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from north of San Luis Pass to High Island; Storm Surge Watch from Port Mansfield to High Island
weather_observation.warning_coast: None at this time (warnings expected Thursday)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Texas coast from Port Mansfield through High Island, with effects extending into southwestern Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) are possible as early as Friday night, with a small (7%) chance of gale intensifying to 50 kt.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 4–6 ft above ground level possible from Port Mansfield to High Island, including Galveston Bay and the Houston Ship Channel.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–15 inches, isolated 20 inches, beginning Friday and continuing through the weekend, likely causing significant flooding around the port complex.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Prolonged heavy rain could stall operations for several days; life-threatening rip currents and rough seas will impede vessel movements; possible power outages and access disruption on port road/rail corridors.
